intro: Acourtia hidalgoana, commonly known as Hidalgo's acourtia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters. Acourtia hidalgoana is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological role in its native habitat.
